newsitem.title: ITALY: Italian police arrest 11 Mafiosi from key clan.
newsitem.headline: Italian police arrest 11 Mafiosi from key clan.

text.p: Italian police said on Thursday they had detained 11 members of the Corleone Mafia clan of arrested boss of bosses Salvatore Riina.
Among those arrested in the swoop, which was ordered by prosecutors in the Sicilian capital Palermo and based on testimony from Mafia turncoats, was Riina's nephew, Mario Grizzaffi.
The 11 were charged with being high-ranking members of Cosa Nostra and deputising for Riina and other arrested Mob bosses. Police gave no details of the operation.
Prosecutors alleged Grizzaffi took part in numerous Mafia summits and that he and others sheltered Mafiosi on the run, stored weapons and blackmailed businessmen.
Two men in their 60s were among those detained.
Riina's clan, from the hilltop town of Corleone immortalised in Hollywood's Godfather movies, rose to prominence at the head of Cosa Nostra with a reign of terror which shook even the Mob.
Riina was arrested in January 1993 after nearly 23 years on the run.
